cmp: 尼 (Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings))
匕 (an ancient type of spoon, dagger/ladle)
mng: particle indicating that a previously asked question is to be applied to the preceding word ("What about ...?", "And ...?"), particle for inquiring about location ("Where is ...?"), particle signaling a pause, to emphasize the preceding words and allow the listener time to take them on board ("ok?", "are you with me?"), (at the end of a declarative sentence) particle indicating continuation of a state or action, particle indicating strong affirmation

exm.mng: particle indicating that a previously asked question is to be applied to the preceding word ("What about ...?", "And ...?"), particle for inquiring about location ("Where is ...?"), particle signaling a pause, to emphasize the preceding words and allow the listener time to take them on board ("ok?", "are you with me?"), (at the end of a declarative sentence) particle indicating continuation of a state or action, particle indicating strong affirmation
comes at the end of the sentence to indicate a strong degree, quite, rather
why bother?, is it worth the trouble?
whispering in a low voice (idiom); murmuring
tweed cloth (used for military uniforms etc)
Om Mani Padma Hum (sanskrit), or Om mani padme hum (Tibetan), the Avalokiteshvara mantra
exm.pyn: ǎn ma ní bā mī mōu

exm.mng: Om Mani Padma Hum (sanskrit), or Om mani padme hum (Tibetan), the Avalokiteshvara mantra, also written 唵嘛呢叭咪哞 唵嘛呢叭咪哞
exm.pyn: ǎn ma mī ba ní mōu

exm.mng: don't use a sledgehammer to crack a nut, de minimis non curat praetor (trivial matters are of no concern to a high official)
exm.pyn: shā jī hé bì yào yòng niú dāo ne
